newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar drifts lower in light volume.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar drifts lower in light volume.

text.p: White sugar futures headed lower in tight ranges and muted volume on Monday but light mixed buying kept nearby August hovering above initial support at $325, traders said.
After a flurry of fund-inspired buying at the start of last week, which pushed August to a high of $330.80, the position has steadily retraced as profits were taken.
The $330.80 high was the culmination of a rally started in mid-January when August hit a low of $295.00.
But with the lack of movement in New York, hoped for by London traders to inspire more activity on the whites, London failed to kick into life, traders said.
"London is very quiet and there's not a great deal of interest," said one trader.
"I think people are still a little surprised the market is holding so well in New York but London is going to be well supported down to $320," he said.
The spot weakness caused August/October to narrow slightly from the $10 seen in earlier trading and little interest was reported on the July/August arbitrage.
At 1510 GMT August was down 90 cents at $325.10 and October down 40 cents at $315.60. Volume was 541 lots.
Technical analysts pegged August support at $325, followed by trendline support at around $323. On the upside, prices were expected to target $331 and thence $341, they said.
Results are still awaited in Bangladesh's tender to buy 25,000 tonnes of white sugar for shipment by August 8. Bidding took place on June 8.
In Paris just 144 lots of the two nearby months changed hands. August was down $1.00 at $325.00 and October down 70 cents at $315.50.
